extendedIngredients.name: rice
extendedIngredients.original: 1 (8.8-ounce) package precooked long-grain rice (such as Uncle Ben's Ready Rice)
extendedIngredients.originalName: package precooked long-grain rice (such as Uncle Ben's Ready Rice)

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 pounds large shrimp, peeled and deveined

title: Shrimp with Capers, Garlic, and Rice
summary: Shrimp with Capers, Garlic, and Rice is a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian main course. One serving contains 424 calories, 40g of protein, and 5g of fat. This recipe serves 4. For $4.04 per serving, this recipe covers 22% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. Head to the store and pick up capers, olive oil, garlic cloves, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the rice you could follow this main course with the Rice Pudding as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 12 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 67%. This score is solid. Try Shrimp Puttanesca Rice Bowl with Capers & Tomatoes, Garlic Chive Shrimp Fried Rice With Garlic Chips, and Garlic Shrimp and Rice for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp can be paired with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. You could try Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.

instructions: Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add thyme, capers, and garlic; saut 1 minute. Add shrimp and lemon juice; saut 4 minutes or until shrimp are done.                                                                                                 Microwave rice according to package directions. Serve shrimp mixture over rice.                                                                                                Serve with: Greek-Style Green Beans

steps.step: Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add thyme, capers, and garlic; saut 1 minute.
Add shrimp and lemon juice; saut 4 minutes or until shrimp are done.
Microwave rice according to package directions.
